sentences.sContent: Knowing we’d won was a wonderful feeling.
sentences.sCn: 得知我们赢了，感觉真好。

sentences.sContent: He’s considerate of other people’s feelings.
...I was feeling so intentional and strong that I wasn’t going to let fear just take over...
...Leah easily could have fallen into a trap of feeling content; instead...
...there was a feeling of community that had grown...
...Nearly twice as many women than men ages 18-44 reported feeling very tired or exhausted...
...I've got a feeling that trade union representative is behind this...
...Doesn't a wallet－that time－honored Friday－night feeling of pleasing...
...Surveys estimate that 85% of women and 73% of men report feeling better after shedding tears...
...but the fact is that people report feeling happier after crying...
...But crying as an expression of feeling is uique to humans and has played an essential role in human evolution and the development of human cultures...
...a feeling not dissimilar to that of a fire in the fireplace on a cold winter's night...

synos.tran: [生理]感觉，触觉；[心理]感情，情绪；同情
有感觉的；有同情心的；富于感情的
[生理]感觉；认为（feel的现在分词）；触摸

phrases.pCn: 接受、承认个人的真实情感

words.tran: 感动地，充满感情地；衷心地
[动] 触角；试探；试探者；厚薄规

trans.tranOther: an emotion that you feel, such as anger, sadness, or happiness
